comments.body: ic, so the problem was that we were mutating the firewall object, right?
yes. This caused the later test cases picked up an unexpected firewall object.

@freehan @cheftako @MrHohn @prameshj -- `k8s.io/utils/net.ParseIPNets` returns an `IPNetSet` (which is like a map) and the `StringSlice` method doesn't deterministically return a list of strings. The test is failing for that reason.

Can you please fix this? Or, should this PR be reverted, for now, considering that Code Freeze is very near and presubmits are failing?

Ref: 
1. https://prow.k8s.io/job-history/gs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/directory/pull-kubernetes-unit
2. Some failed Jobs:
  - https://prow.k8s.io/view/gs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/99641/pull-kubernetes-unit/1367778084027109376
  - https://prow.k8s.io/view/gs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/99423/pull-kubernetes-unit/1367803543393669120
  - https://prow.k8s.io/view/gs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/99817/pull-kubernetes-unit/1367776489864433664
  - https://prow.k8s.io/view/gs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/98883/pull-kubernetes-unit/1367785835595829248
  - https://prow.k8s.io/view/gs/kubernetes-jenkins/pr-logs/pull/99210/pull-kubernetes-unit/1367783644051017728

xref: https://kubernetes.slack.com/archives/C2C40FMNF/p1614942354205800
Thank you folks! Fix is in #99858

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1342,1346 @@	require.NoError(t, err)
	srcRanges := []string{"10.10.0.0/24", "10.20.0.0/24"}
	sourceRanges, _ := utilnet.ParseIPNets(srcRanges...)
	fwName := "test-fw"
	fwDesc := "test-desc"

comments.body: @aojea pretty sure this just needs a sort here instead of a revert
Agreed! A sort will fix the test for now.
